title: How to Make White Chocolate and Mint Mousse

text: Melt the Chocolate Create a double boiler. Add about an inch or two of water in a pot. Place a fitting bowl over the top of the pot. Make sure that the bowl does not touch the water in the pot. Break the chocolate into pieces. Use your hands to break them into good sized chunks and add it to the bowl. Place the pot over a high heat. Bring the water to a first boil. Remove the pot from the heat when the water first starts to boil. Allow the chocolate to melt and cool. Stir the chocolate until it completely melts and allow it to cool to room temperature. Whip the Egg Whites and Cream Whisk the egg whites until they form soft peaks. Add the sugar and whisk again. Whisk your cream up lightly to form soft peaks.  Gently fold the melted chocolate into the cream along with a few drops of the peppermint extract.  Fold in the Egg Whites Add a spoonful of egg whites into the cream. Fold it in and mix vigorously. Gently fold in the rest of the egg whites. Ensure that everything is thoroughly mixed together. Refrigerate the mixture. Pour into glasses or a bowl and allow to set in the fridge for at least an hour, but preferably overnight. Garnish the dessert. Crumble chocolate flakes or grated chocolate on top of the dessert. Add a sprig of fresh mint and serve. Finished.
